00001 #ifndef _COMMON_H_
00002 #define _COMMON_H_
00003 #define CRC_16  0xa001          /* CRC-16 polynomial (used by modbus) */
00004 #define CRC_CCITT 0x8408        /* CCITT polynomial */
00005 typedef __uint8_t uint8;
00006 typedef __uint16_t uint16;
00007 
00008 /************************************************************************
00009  * Function: mbcrc_calc, mbcrc_tlu
00010  * Parameters: data - pointer to array of unsigned *8 bit characters.
00011  *             len - length of data array
00012  * Purpose:  These function will calculate or lookup the 16 bit CRC
00013  *           value of a character array.  Numerical CRC caluclation
00014  *           requires more processing time than table lookup.
00015  * Types:    uint8 is an 8 bit unsigned integer type.  Usually uint8
00016  *                  is realized with 'unsigned char'.
00017  *           uint16 is a 16 bit unisgned integer type.  Usually uint16
00018  *                  is realized with 'unsigned short'.
00019  ************************************************************************/
00020 
00021 uint16 mbcrc_calc(uint8 *data, int len);
00022 uint16 mbcwc_tlu(uint8 *data, int len);
00023

00088 /**********************************************************************
00089  * Function: init_serial()
00090  * Description: Configure, open and initialize the serial port
00091  * Arguments:
00092  *        portfn -     - Port filename
00093  *         brate -     - baudrate
00094  *        portfd - out - file descriptor returned by open()
00095  * Return Values:
00096  *    0 - OK
00097  *   -1 - open() failed
00098  * Bugs: none known
00099  * Notes: Stable through several program revisions.
00100  * Last Update: 6/15/02
00101  * Last Updated By: Cengiz Akinli
00102  **********************************************************************/
00103 
00104 int init_serial(char *portfn, speed_t brate, int *portfd);
00105 
00106 
00107 
00108 
00109 /**********************************************************************
00110  * Function: say()
00111  * Description: Perform blocked, looped, write to a file
00112  * Arguments:
00113  *            fd - target file descriptor
00114  *           str - string to write
00115  * Return Values:
00116  *    0 - OK
00117  * Bugs: Vulnerable to signal interruption of read loop.  See code comment.
00118  * Notes: Does dumb writing only.  Checks bytes successfully written,
00119  *        but does not loop to write the remainder.  Such a loop, when it
00120  *        is added to this software, should go here.
00121  * Last Update: 7/1/02
00122  * Last Updated By: Cengiz Akinli
00123  **********************************************************************/
00124 
00125 int say(int fd, char *str);
00126 
00127 
00128 
00129 
00130 /**********************************************************************
00131  * Function: hear()
00132  * Description: Read data from the given fd into str with various parameters.
00133  *      Reads up to maxlen bytes.  Blocks for no more than maxbtime*3 usecs
00134  *      until either minlen bytes are read (if minlen is non-zero) or the
00135  *      term character is read in (which is included in the output string).
00136  * Arguments:
00137  *            fd -     - source file descriptor
00138  *           str - out - pre-allocated string buffer in which results
00139  *                      will be stored
00140  *        maxlen -     - Maxmimum number of bytes to read (must be <= number
00141  *                      of bytes allocated for str)
00142  *        minlen -     -  0 - No minumum input byte counting
00143  *                       >0 - Minumum number of bytes to read (see desc.)
00144  *      maxbtime -     - Max blocking time per select() in usec (see desc)
00145  *          term -     - Terminator character to mark end of input
00146  *
00147  * Return Values:
00148  *    0 - OK
00149  *    1 - Read 0 bytes
00150  * Bugs:  Vulnerable to signal interruption of write loop.  See code comment.
00151  * Notes: Use of minlen is deprecated vs term character selection.  In either
00152  *      case, blocking time is still limited to 3*maxbtime usec.
00153  * Last Update: 7/1/02
00154  * Last Updated By: Cengiz Akinli
00155  **********************************************************************/
00156 
00157 int hear(int fd, char *str, int maxlen, int minlen, int maxbtime, char term);
